It only appears if a player's highest combat stat is melee; if it is magic or ranged, the avatar of ranging or strength will appear instead, respectively. However, this is not guaranteed as there is an element of randomness programed into the encounter.[1]

The Arzinian Avatar of Magic is an avatar of the Arzinian Being of Bordanzan that may be fought in the Between a Rock... quest. It only appears if a player's highest combat stat is melee; if it is magic or ranged, the avatar of ranging or strength will appear instead, respectively. However, this is not guaranteed as there is an element of randomness programed into the encounter.[1]

Its strength is based on how much gold ore a player has in their inventory. If fought with 5 or less gold ore, it will have no combat level and possess the ability to infinitely regenerate. If fought with at least 6 ores, it will be level 125, and if fought with 15 or more, it will be level 75.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
5 July –
19 September 2005

The NPC's examine was changed from "It is the avatar of the Arzininan[sic] Being of Bordanzan, representing magic." to "It is the avatar of the Arzinian Being of Bordanzan, representing magic."

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 20 October 2020. (Archived from the original on 20 October 2020.) Mod Ash: "There's a comment in the code that says "randomize it just a little bit" - looks like it's intentional that you don't always get the [Avatar form] you might expect."
